thread.title: Sesame Street introduces its first autistic character Julia - US TV
thread.title_full: Sesame Street introduces its first autistic character Julia - US TV News - Digital Spy

author: Sam Warner
title: Sesame Street introduces its first autistic character Julia - US TV
text: Sesame Street has introduced a new character called Julia, who has autism.She has joined the cast as part of the programme's new initiative Sesame Street and Autism: See Amazing in All Children. © Marybeth Nelson Julia has been created to reduce the stigma of autism, as children with autism are five times more likely to get bullied, according to Dr Jeanette Betancourt, senior vice president of US social impact."With one in 68 children having autism, that's a lot of bullying," she told People. "Our goal is to bring forth what all children share in common, not their differences." The initiative is targeted at communities with children aged between 2 and 5, and will hopefully help non-autistic children interact with their autistic peers.We're SO excited to announce the launch of our new initiative Sesame Street and Autism: #SeeAmazing in All Children! pic.twitter.com/cC3Efchtlq— Sesame Street (@sesamestreet) October 21, 2015"When we explain from a child's point of view that there are certain behaviours, such as slapping their hands or making noises, to express excitement or unhappiness, it helps younger children to understand how to interact with their autistic peers," she said."It makes children more comfortable and therefore more inclusive."As part of the awareness campaign, the show's creators have made the hashtag #SeeAmazing for social media.It was announced in August that Sesame Street will premiere on HBO for the next five years.Watch the video for 'The Amazing Song' below:
